citeinfo.title: Sleepers River Replicate Statistics
citeinfo.othercit: This metadata file describes 1 of the 6 data tables published together (see Larger Work section).

citeinfo.title: Aqueous chemistry database, Sleepers River Research Watershed, Danville, Vermont, 1991-2018

descript.abstract: This file summarizes laboratory performance of replicate samples. The majority of these replicates represent a comparison between results from the U.S. Forest Service laboratory in Durham NH, which has analyzed weekly samples throughout the life of the project and thus provides continuity, and another laboratory used by the project at the time of sampling. The remaining replicates represent samples collected in duplicate and sent to the same laboratory for analysis. While a given replicate is analyzed by the same laboratory, the laboratory might be any one of the eighteen used during this project.
descript.purpose: Replicate sampling is an established way to check on laboratory performance. It was most efficient to summarize the results of these comparisons in a dedicated file apart from the overall chemistry file.

idinfo.accconst: None. Please see 'Distribution Info' for details.
idinfo.useconst: None. Users are advised to read the dataset's metadata thoroughly to understand appropriate use and data limitations.
idinfo.datacred: U.S. Geological Survey Land Change Science

attracc.attraccr: Mean relative percent difference (Mean_RPD) and median percent error (Median_PE) of sample replicates provide some measure of precision for the analyses presented in "1. Sleepers River Aqueous Chemistry.csv." The calculations in and of themselves are determinations of precision. Any uncertainty lies in the analyses themselves and not in the calculations. See "Process Steps" and "Overview Description" for a detailed description of calculations and data table organization.

dataqual.complete: Dataset is considered complete for the information presented 08/01/1991-12/31/2018.

procstep.procdesc: Mean relative percent difference ("Mean_RPD") is calculated as ( |Replicate1 - Replicate2| / (Replicate1 + Replicate2) / 2 ) X 100 where "Replicate1" and "Replicate2" refer to replicate sample concentrations. Median percent error ("Median_PE") is calculated as ( "Other Lab" - "USFS Durham" / "USFS Durham" ) X 100 where "Other Lab" and "USFS Durham" refer to replicate sample concentrations. See "Overview Description" for a more detailed description of these terms.

enttyp.enttypd: This comma delimited (CSV) table presents summary statistics for sample replicates by analyte. NA denotes no data.

attr.attrdef: Replicates are divided into two categories-"Other Labs vs USFS Durham" and "Field Replicate." See "Overview Description" for more detail.
Sample type designations are defined below and in more detail in "Overview Description."

edom.edomvd: Weekly precipitation sample
Stream sample
Mixture of multiple sample types

attr.attrdef: The chemical constituent analyzed. Abbreviations and units of measurement are defined below. The analyte names reported in this column also appear as column names in “1. Sleepers River Aqueous Chemistry.csv.”

edom.edomvd: Specific conductivity measured in microsiemens per centimeter (µS/cm)
Calcium measured in microequivalents per liter (µeq/L)
Chloride measured in microequivalents per liter (µeq/L)
Dissolved organic carbon measured in milligrams per liter (mg/L)
Potassium measured in microequivalents per liter (µeq/L)
Magnesium measured in microequivalents per liter (µeq/L)
Sodium measured in microequivalents per liter (µeq/L)
Ammonium measured in microequivalents per liter (µeq/L)
Nitrate measured in microequivalents per liter (µeq/L)
pH unit
Silicon measured in micromoles per liter (µmol/L)
Sulfate measured in microequivalents per liter (µeq/L)
Total dissolved nitrogen measured in milligrams per liter (mg/L)
Acid neutralizing capacity measured in microequivalents per liter (µeq/L)
Aluminum measured in micrograms per liter (µg/L)
Barium measured in micrograms per liter (µg/L)
Iron measured in micrograms per liter (µg/L)
Manganese measured in micrograms per liter (µg/L)
Oxygen 18O/16O isotope mass ratio in water, presented as permil deviation from Vienna Standard Mean Ocean Water (VSMOW).
Strontium measured in micrograms per liter (µg/L)
Ultraviolet (UV)-absorbance at 254 nanometers reported in cm-1

attr.attrdef: Mean relative percent difference (RPD) where RPD=(|Replicate1-Replicate2|/(Replicate1 + Replicate2)/2)X100 "Replicate1" and "Replicate2" refer to sample concentrations.
Median percent error (PE) where PE=("Other Lab"-"USFS Durham"/"USFS Durham")X100 "Other Lab" and "USFS Durham" refer to sample concentrations.

overview.eaover: Table "5. Sleepers River Replicate Statistics.csv" presents summary statistics for sample replicates by analyte. Replicates fall into two categories which are identified in the "Replicate_Type" column. The first category ("Other Labs vs USFS Durham") results from the overlap of samples analyzed weekly by the U.S. Forest Service lab in Durham, NH with the event- and project-based samples collected simultaneously and analyzed by 17 other laboratories on a by-project basis. These replicates share the same name and type and are collected within 3 minutes of each other if they are stream samples, or 4 hours of each other if they are precipitation samples, but they are analyzed by two different labs, one that remains the same throughout the 30-year period of record ("USFS Durham"), and one that varies on a by-project basis ("Other Labs"). These replicates are also individually denoted in "1. Sleepers River Aqueous Chemistry.csv" with a "Yes" in the "Replicate" column. The second category ("Field Replicate") refers to samples collected in duplicate and sent to the same laboratory for analysis. These replicates are reported as averages in "1. Sleepers River Aqueous Chemistry.csv" and are not individually denoted. Note that while a given replicate in this category is analyzed by the same laboratory, laboratories changed over time, so replicates summarized in this table may have been analyzed at any of the 18 laboratories described in "3. Sleepers River Laboratory Information.csv." "Other Labs vs USFS Durham" replicate statistics are reported by sample type and have one of two designations in the "Sample_Type" column-steam sample (ST) and weekly precipitation sample (PW). "Field Replicate" replicate statistics are not reported by sample type because they represent many more sample types and splitting by type would prevent robust statistical computation. As a result, these samples are designated "Mixed" in the "Sample_Type" column. Note that column "Median_PE" is only populated for "Other Labs vs USFS Durham" replicates. Percent error (PE) is calculated relative to the Durham lab in order to capture laboratory bias. This metric is irrelevant for the "Field Replicate" category as these replicates were analyzed at the same laboratory. Additional metrics of chemical analysis performance can be found in "3. Sleepers River Laboratory Information.csv," "4. Sleepers River Interlaboratory Comparison.csv," and "6. Sleepers River Blank Statistics.csv."

distinfo.distliab: Unless otherwise stated, all data, metadata and related materials are considered to satisfy the quality standards relative to the purpose for which the data were collected. Although these data and associated metadata have been reviewed for accuracy and completeness and approved for release by the U.S. Geological Survey (USGS), no warranty expressed or implied is made regarding the display or utility of the data on any other system or for general or scientific purposes, nor shall the act of distribution constitute any such warranty. Any use of trade, firm, or product names is for descriptive purposes only and does not imply endorsement by the U.S. Government.
